title: Norway’s former PM, Thorbjoern Jagland, accused of aggravated corruption over Epstein links
byline: Norway has been rocked by the release of millions of files that allegedly show politicians and top diplomats had extensive contact with convicted US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall above 50mm likely in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Central, Uva, Eastern provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Hambantota districts today (13), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Berlin Film Festival kicks off with a nod to new voices from Michelle Yeoh
byline: The Berlin Film Festival opened on Thursday night with the message that new voices matter as Hollywood legend Michelle Yeoh recalled how the festival supported her early in her career.

title: Bangladesh’s BNP wins big in historic parliamentary election
byline: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party won a landslide parliamentary election on Friday, local TV stations showed, securing a resounding mandate in a pivotal vote that is expected to restore political stability in the South Asian nation.

title: Sri Lanka briefs EU on steps taken towards advancing reconciliation
byline: The European Union (EU) and Sri Lanka convened the 27th Session of the EU-Sri Lanka Joint Commission meeting in Colombo.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Southern provinces.

title: Former Minister Johnston and sons further remanded
byline: Five suspects including former Minister Johnston Fernando and his two sons, who were arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID), have been further remanded until February 20 by the Wattala Magistrate’s Court.

title: Low-pressure area likely to form over southeastern Bay of Bengal – Met. Dept
byline: The Department of Meteorology has stated that a low-pressure area is likely to form over the southeastern Bay of Bengal around February 15.

title: New Secretary appointed to Ministry of Digital Economy
byline: Waruna Sri Dhanapala has been appointed as Secretary to the Ministry of Digital Economy by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Education transformation is essential to rebuild the country - PM
byline: The Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, stated that, aligning with the development activities carried out under the new education reforms,...

title: Former Minister Prof. Tissa Vitharana passes away
byline: Veteran politician and former Minister Professor Tissa Vitharana has passed away at the age of 91, according to family members.

title: Lawyer and wife killed in Akuregoda shooting: ‘Karandeniya Sudda’ ordered hit?
byline: The two persons, including a woman, who were shot dead this evening (13) near a supermarket in Akuregoda have been identified as an attorney who had represented the underworld figure known as “Karandeniya Sudda,” and his wife, police said.

title: Landslide early warnings issued to areas in two districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for several areas in two districts within the Central Province.

title: Woman killed, 3 injured after elephant rampage in Valaichchenai
byline: A woman has died while three others sustained injuries after being attacked by a wild elephant that stormed into the Valaichchenai town in Batticaloa this morning.

title: Validity period of vouchers to purchase school shoes extended
byline: The validity period for vouchers worth Rs. 3000 issued to selected schoolchildren, Piriven students, and Seela Mathas for the purchase of shoes in 2026 has been extended.

title: Sri Lanka’s strategic location affords ‘outsized importance’, but can become target for coercion – US official
byline: In a high-level hearing before the US House Foreign Affairs Subcommittee on South and Central Asia, a top official of the US State Department underscored the critical strategic importance of Sri Lanka to global energy security and maritime commerce.

title: Second phase of first school term for 2026 ends
byline: The second phase of the first school term for 2026 concluded today (13), the Ministry of Education announced.

title: Shooting at South Carolina State University leaves two dead, one wounded
byline: Two people were killed and one other was wounded in a shooting on Thursday night at a dormitory of South Carolina State University, a historically Black college, prompting a campus lockdown, school officials said in a statement.

title: Sajith claims all five coal shipments to Lakvijaya Plant were substandard
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa alleged that all five shipments of coal imported for the Lakvijaya Coal Power Plant in Norochcholai contained substandard coal.

title: US, Taiwan finalise deal to cut tariffs, boost purchases of US goods
byline: Trump administration officials signed a final reciprocal trade agreement that confirmed a 15% U.S. tariff rate for imports from Taiwan, while committing Taiwan to a schedule for eliminating or lowering tariffs on nearly all U.S. goods.

title: President Dissanayake congratulates Bangladesh on democratic elections
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has extended his best wishes to the people of Bangladesh for reaffirming their faith in democracy following the country’s elections.

title: SC reviews recovery of excise duty arrears from defaulting liquor manufacturers
byline: The Attorney General informed the Supreme Court today (13) that all measures have been taken to recover arrears of excise duty from alcohol manufacturing companies that have defaulted on payments.

title: Vehicle importers predict price hikes with new tax from April 1
byline: The Vehicle Importers’ Association of Sri Lanka (VIASL) has stated that a 2.5% tax has been introduced on imported vehicles, effective from April 01, 2026.

title: 30kg of Kerala cannabis seized in Masar
byline: A total of 30 kilograms of Kerala cannabis, with an estimated street value of approximately Rs. 10.5 million, has been seized during a joint operation conducted in the Masar area of the Palai police division.

title: Three sentenced to death over Waskaduwa murder in 2008
byline: Three individuals have been sentenced to death today (13) by the Kalutara High Court in connection with the 2008 Waskaduwa murder case.

title: Passport services resume as Immigration Dept. computer system restored
byline: The computer system at the Department of Immigration and Emigration has been fully restored, and passport services at the main office in Battaramulla and regional offices have returned to normal, the department announced.

title: Two suspects arrested over financial fraud targeting women
byline: Two suspects including a woman have been arrested by the North Western Province Unit of the Computer Crime Investigation Division (CCID) for their alleged involvement in two instances of financial fraud.

title: Man and woman shot dead inside car in Akuregoda
byline: Two persons including a woman are reported dead following a shooting incident in Akuregoda, a short while ago.

title: New ‘John Wick’ game with Keanu Reeves in lead role announced
byline: Lionsgate and Saber Interactive have announced a new AAA video game based on the John Wick franchise, with the project revealed during Sony’s State of Play showcase.

title: Over 800 arrested in island-wide anti-drug raids yesterday: Police
byline: A total of 820 individuals were arrested during island-wide raids conducted yesterday (12) under the “Nation United – National Drive” campaign.

title: Protesting fishermen to meet President for discussion today
byline: Fishermen engaged in a Satyagraha campaign in front of the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo, demanding permission to carry out Madel (seine net) fishing activities using tractor-mounted winches, have been granted a discussion with the President this evening (13).

title: Fishermen end ‘Satyagraha’ over seine fishing ban after talks with President
byline: The Satyagraha campaign launched by a group of fishermen demanding the lifting of the government’s ban on the use of tractor-mounted winches for Madel (seine net) fishing has been called off, a short while ago.

title: Former DMT Deputy Commissioner arrested over bribery allegations
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has arrested a former Deputy Commissioner of the Motor Vehicle Transfer Division of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT).

title: Case against ex-Minister Keheliya and family fixed for trial
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered that the case filed by the Bribery Commission against former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and his family members, over allegations of illegal acquisition of assets, be taken up for hearing on April 27.

title: Retired Water Board GM arrested on corruption charges
byline: A retired former General Manager of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has been arrested yesterday (12) by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) on corruption-related charges.

title: Ten police teams deployed to probe Akuregoda shooting of lawyer and wife
byline: Ten police teams, including personnel from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and the Special Task Force (STF), have been deployed to investigate the killing of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda this evening (13), Sri Lanka Police stated.

title: President agrees on immediate action plan during talks with protesting fishermen
byline: A discussion between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and the Madel (beach seine net) fishermen who engaged in a protest in front of the Presidential Secretariat was held this afternoon (13) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: MP Dilith Jayaweera claims Trinco Buddha statue incident used to stir national unrest
byline: The leader of the Sarvajana Balaya and Member of Parliament, Dilith Jayaweera, today (13) claimed that the recent incident involving a Buddha statue in Trincomalee was deliberately used by the government to create unrest in the country.

title: Ports Minister steps down from committee probing controversial release of 323 containers
byline: Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation, Anura Karunatilaka, has resigned from the Special Parliamentary Select Committee appointed to look into the release of 323 containers from the Colombo Port without being subjected to mandatory physical inspection.

title: Indian team reaches Colombo for high-octane clash against Pakistan
byline: The Indian cricket team led by Suryakumar Yadav reached Colombo on Friday evening for the high-stakes T20 World Cup clash against Pakistan on Sunday.

title: BASL condemns shooting of lawyer and wife in Akuregoda
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has strongly condemned the tragic shooting and assassination of an Attorney-at-Law and his wife today (13) at Akuregoda by a group of unidentified assailants.

title: Colombo will always stand as neutral venue for India-Pakistan engagements – MP Namal
byline: Sri Lankan Member of Parliament (MP) and former Sports Minister Namal Rajapaksa has emphasized that Colombo could serve as a neutral venue for the resumption of bilateral ties between India and Pakistan.
